did.abstract: The Alfred Cortot Collection: Handwritten Manuscripts (dated 1718-1782, undated; 375 0.23 cubic feet; 1 box) consists of the handwritten manuscripts collected by pianist and music educator, Alfred Cortot. As a pianist and music educator, Alfred Cortot actively collected materials relevant to his study of the history and theoretical structure of music and music performance. His larger book collection is cataloged in UK's catalog, infokat. This collection contains primarily theoretical and historical treatises from the 15th to the 19th centuries that were once owned by Cortot.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: Alfred Denis Cortot was born in Nyon, Switzerland, September 26, 1877 and died in Lausanne, Switzerland, June 15, 1962. However, he lived most of his life in Paris. Cortot was a well-known pianist both as a soloist and in a trio he formed with Jacques Thibaud (violin) and Pablo Casals ('cello). As an educator, he was Professor of Piano at the Paris Conservatoire and founded, with violinist Adolphe Mangeot, the Ecole Normale de Musique where he served as director until his death. Cortot wrote three books on French piano music and published more than eighty editions of piano music of various composers. He recorded extensively and is regarded as one of the outstanding pianists of the twentieth century. Cortot was also an avid collector of musical autographs, literature, first and early editions, letters portraits, coins and postage stamps, and he published a catalog of his early books on music theory and history. A large percentage of the books in this collection are listed here.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Alfred Cortot Collection: Handwritten Manuscripts (dated 1718-1782, undated; 375 0.23 cubic feet; 1 box) consists of the handwritten manuscripts collected by pianist and music educator, Alfred Cortot. As a pianist and music educator, Alfred Cortot actively collected materials relevant to his study of the history and theoretical structure of music and music performance. His larger book collection is cataloged in UK's catalog, infokat. This collection contains primarily theoretical and historical treatises from the 15th to the 19th centuries that were once owned by Cortot.. The materials consist of monographs, pamphlets, scores, and manuscripts dealing with the theory and history of music composition, performance, aesthetics, and philosophy.
